problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the arc length of the ABC sector is 15.42, the area of the BDEF parallelogram is 96 and the angle DBF is vertical to CBA, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (13337.439999999999, 10011.640000000001)
B = (34.23, 34.23)
C = (34.23, 16663.24)
D = (-7965.77, -5965.77)
E = (-7965.77, -17965.77)
F = (34.23, -11965.77)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 14))

# Adjust axis limits for better presentation
ax.set_xlim(-19965.77, 20034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-24965.77, 20034.23)

# Draw the lime arc (B, A, C)
radius = 16663.24
start_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(A[1] - B[1], A[0] - B[0]))
end_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(C[1] - B[1], C[0] - B[0]))

if start_angle > end_angle:
    end_angle += 360

arc = patches.Wedge(
    center=B,
    r=radius,
    theta1=start_angle,
    theta2=end_angle,
    facecolor="lime",
    edgecolor="black",
    alpha=0.6
)
ax.add_patch(arc)

# Draw the blue polygon (B, D, E, F)
blue_polygon = patches.Polygon([B, D, E, F], closed=True, color="blue", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(blue_polygon)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((B[0] + F[0]) / 2, (B[1] + F[1]) / 2, "12", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="center")
ax.text((B[0] + D[0]) / 2, (B[1] + D[1]) / 2, "10", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="bottom")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The lengths of the BF and the BD sides of the BDEF parallelogram are 12 and 10 and the area is 96 so the sine of the DBF angle is $\frac{96}{12 * 10} = 0.8$ and so the angle in degrees is $\arcsin(0.8) = 53.13$. The angle CBA is vertical to the angle DBF so the degree of the CBA angle = 53.13. The CBA angle of the ABC sector is 53.13 and the arc length is 15.42 so the BC radius can be computed as $\frac{15.42}{\frac{53.13}{360} * (2 * \pi)} = \frac{15.42}{0.15 * (2 * \pi)} = \frac{15.42}{0.94}= 16.4$. Therefore the final answer is 16.4.
